title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.82 - Executive order no. 82: establishing the governor's office for hispanic affairs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.82 - Executive order no. 82: establishing the governor's office for hispanic affairs

State Regulations
WHEREAS, Members of the Hispanic community have contributed
significantly to the State and its government to the benefit of all of the
people in the State; WHEREAS, The State must continue to be responsive to the
special needs and concerns of its Hispanic citizens; and
WHEREAS, A mechanism must be established to ensure that
members of the Hispanic community have opportunities to participate in all
levels of government: NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the
laws of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Governor's Office for Hispanic Affairs

There is hereby created an office to be known as the

Governor' s Office for Hispanic Affairs (the " Office"), which shall be part of
the Executive Chamber. An Executive Director of the Office shall be appointed
by the Governor to act as the Governor's liaison to the Hispanic
community. II. Purposes and

Responsibilities of the Office

The Office shall advise and provide information and
assistance as appropriate, concerning the following areas: development of increased opportunities for involvement of

Hispanics in all aspects of State government; policies which concern the quality of life of the Hispanic
community; and opportunities for business enterprises owned by Hispanics to
participate in State contracts. The Office shall serve as a clearinghouse for information
and material relevant to the Hispanic community which shall be disseminated in

Spanish and English. The Office shall act as Ombudsman/Advocate for the Hispanic
community. The Office shall be responsible for the coordination of
special interagency projects, specialized studies and evaluation of interagency
issues. The Office shall monitor implementation of recommendations
made by State agencies and the Governor's Advisory Committee for Hispanic

Affairs in the continuing effort to meet the special needs of the Hispanic
community. The Office, in conjunction with the Governor's Executive

Committee for Affirmative Action, the President of the Civil Service

Commission, the Commissioner of the Division of Human Rights, the Secretary to
the Governor, the Director of State Operations, the Director of Administration
(appointments), the Director of the Office of State Contract Compliance and

Minority and Women- Owned Business Enterprises, the Secretary of State, the

Director of the Budget, the Commissioner of Labor, the Director of Employee

Relations, the Director of the Women' s Division, the Advocate for the

Disabled, and the New York State Director of Veterans' Affairs, shall take
necessary steps to assist the effective implementation of programs to increase
employment opportunities for Hispanics in State government. The Office may request and shall receive from any
department, division, board, bureau, commission or agency of the State such
information and assistance that will enable it to carry out its purpose and
responsibilities hereunder. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: May 2, 1986
